questions.question: True or False: Any statement that doesn't use the words "think," "should" or "feel" is a fact.
A __________ is something you can verify, or prove.
You should support your opinions with facts using __________ to make them more convincing.
Raul says that there are 10 inches in a foot.  You see this is incorrect.  His statement was _
Which of the following statements is an opinion?

choices.answer: People shouldn't text at the dinner table.
37% of teens have an iPad or Kindle.
Stephanie received a cell phone for her 18th birthday.

questions.question: Sue thinks dogs are better pets than cats.  Meg is convinced by Sue's reasons. Meg _____.

choices.answer: must have been tricked by false facts

questions.question: Sue thinks she should have a pet dog. Which is the bestway to convince her dad of her opinion?

choices.answer: remind him of her opinion about dogs every day before school
write a list of false facts about cats
ask all of her friends for their opinions about pets
tell her dad facts that support her opinion
provide facts that use evidence to support her opinion
include no facts in this essay - only her opinion
include only false facts in this essay that she makes up
never directly state her opinion about sports

questions.question: Anna is writing an opinion piece about the best sport.  She should __________.

choices.answer: The average person produces 4 pounds of trash a day.

questions.question: Which of the following is an opinion?

choices.answer: Teens should be allowed to see movies with PG-13 ratings.
